detaileddescription.para:
Handle the drawing related tasks of the check boxes
cb
pointer to an object
mask
the object will be drawn only in this area
mode
LV_DESIGN_COVER_CHK: only check if the object fully covers the 'mask_p' area (return 'true' if yes) LV_DESIGN_DRAW: draw the object (always return 'true') LV_DESIGN_DRAW_POST: drawing after every children are drawn
return
true/false, depends on 'mode'

Handle the drawing related tasks of the check boxes
bullet
pointer to an object
mask
the object will be drawn only in this area
mode
LV_DESIGN_COVER_CHK: only check if the object fully covers the 'mask_p' area (return 'true' if yes) LV_DESIGN_DRAW: draw the object (always return 'true') LV_DESIGN_DRAW_POST: drawing after every children are drawn
return
true/false, depends on 'mode'

Signal function of the check box
cb
pointer to a check box object
sign
a signal type from lv_signal_t enum
param
pointer to a signal specific variable
LV_RES_OK: the object is not deleted in the function; LV_RES_INV: the object is deleted

Create a check box objects
par
pointer to an object, it will be the parent of the new check box
copy
pointer to a check box object, if not NULL then the new object will be copied from it
pointer to the created check box

Set the text of a check box. txt will be copied and may be deallocated after this function returns.
cb
pointer to a check box
txt
the text of the check box. NULL to refresh with the current text.

Set the text of a check box. txt must not be deallocated during the life of this checkbox.
cb
pointer to a check box
txt
the text of the check box. NULL to refresh with the current text.

Set a style of a check box
cb
pointer to check box object
type
which style should be set
style
pointer to a style

Get the text of a check box
cb
pointer to check box object
pointer to the text of the check box

Get a style of a button
cb
pointer to check box object
type
which style should be get
style pointer to the style
